results.title: Classical Hollywood style
results.creator_credit: Molly Ornati, Lawrence Pitkethly, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “American cinema”.
In classical Hollywood film, the story is primary. Filmmakers rely on style, structure, narrative and visual elements to tell their story. Martin Scorcese and Sydney Pollack are among the directors who discuss their own style and how the classical Hollywood style, although evolving, endures and impacts on their work.

results.title: Classical and operant conditioning
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Psychology Live”.
This program looks at theories of learning, particularly those of Classical and Operant Conditioning. Although tailored to year 12 and tertiary Psychology students, the program’s information is of general interest and contains several practical exercises, real life demonstrations and self-tests. The presenters support the “ecological approach” of cognitive psychology, which values the research done in situations of everyday life, not just in laboratories. Following an introduction to the study of behaviourism, this program discusses in detail the theories and terminolgy of past and present theories of behaviorism including I.P. Pavlov’s Classical Conditioning and B.F Skinner’s Operant Conditioning. The studies these researchers undertook are outlined and commented on, including the ethical issues regarding their work such as the animal experimentation issues associated with Pavlov’s dogs. The theories are then compared and assessed and discussed in terms of relevance and application in contemporary studies of learning and behaviour. Study notes included.

results.title: Classical
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Orchestra Series”.
Part Three of the Orchestra Series which describes the evolution of the modern symphony orchestra from its beginnings in the 17th Century to the present. By the middle of the 18th Century the “wind band” has become part of the classical orchestra, and the newly invented clarinet was all the rage. European orchestra owed their existence and development to patronage, but in England public concerts had been provoked commercially as early as 1672. A century later subscription concerts were held in London, creating a musically literate public. In this program the English Chamber Orchestra plays in the Assembly Rooms, Bath.

results.title: Classic tales; English Gentlemen
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Best of British”.
The ultimate collection of scenes from feature films inspired by the literary giants Shakespeare, Shaw, Dickens, Wilde and Wells. Some of the great classic films based on literature are featured including “Oliver Twist”, “Caesar and Cleopatra” and ‘The Importance of being Earnest’. In the episode entitled the “English gentlemen”, the image of this stereotype as portrayed in film is discussed. It is a reflection on the urbane and sometimes eccentric characters portrayed by such stars as Rex Harrison, Michael Wilding and Stanley Holloway. Narrated by Sir John Mills.

results.title: Classic rock: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains fourteen classic rock anthems from an array of British musicians, performed live. The tracks are: Wishbone Ash “Blowin’ free”; Argent “Hold your head up”; The Sensational Alex Harvey band “Delilah”; Uriah Heep “Return to fantasy”; Asia “Heat of the moment”; Focus “Sylvia”; Emerson, Lake & Palmer “The Barbarian”; Family “Strange band”; Curved air “Melinda more or less”; Slade “Get down and get with it”; Deep Purple “Child in time”; Free “I’ll be moving”; Thin Lizzy “The Sun goes down”; Barclay James Harvest “Mockingbird”.

results.title: Classic old, exciting new
results.brief_description: This film shows the work of the Australian Museum’s many sections - the storage facilities, the maintenance necessary, the preparation of exhibits and the research and publications sections. All are of vital importance to the preservation of our Australian heritage.

results.title: Classic Looney Tunes Cartoons
results.brief_description: Released as a 50th birthday tribute to Bugs Bunny, this series of videos are collections of classic Warner Bros. cartoons of all your favourite characters, from Daffy Duck to Porky Pig. Sit back and enjoy the fun-filled animation that is instantly recognisable and famous world-wide.

results.title: Classic Everest
results.brief_description: Looks at a group of ordinary people as they travel part way up Mount Everest. the group is led by tashi tensing, grandson of the famous sherpa who accompanied Hilary on the first successful climb of Everest. Also includes rare footage of the bones claimed to be from the famous Yeti, along with the Mani Rhindu festival at the Tenboche Monastry.

results.title: Classe Tous Risques = the Big Risk
results.creator_credit: Jacques Plante, Robert Amon, Jean Darvey and Claude Sautet
results.brief_description:
Abel Davos is on the most wanted list in both France and Italy. With the assistance of Naldi, he manages to reunite with Therese, his wife, and their children in the border town of Vintimillle. As they make their way to Menton, the police attempt to arrest them. The operation takes a nasty turn and both Therese and Naldi are killed. Abel and the children go into hiding in Nice where Abel endeavours to re-establish contact with former accomplices and organise a bank robbery.

Credits: Producers, Jean Darvey, Robert Amon, Jacques Plante ; director, Claude Sautet ; writers, Claude Sautet, Pascal Jardin, Jose Giovanni ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Lino Ventura, Jean-Paul Belmondo, Sandra Milo, Jacques Dacqmine, Marcel Dalio, Bernard Dheran, Claude Cerval, Michel Ardan, Rene Genin, Charles Blavette.
